context: The Estonian pronoun 'me' is the short form of 'meie' and means 'we' in English. It's used as the first-person plural pronoun, referring to the speaker plus at least one other person. In declension, 'me' has forms like 'meid' (partitive), 'meile' (allative), 'meil' (adessive), and others depending on grammatical case requirements.
